problem_text: If L K = 4, M P = 3, P Q = 6, K J = 2, R S = 6, and L P = 2, find J H.
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: 6 = RS, 6 = PQ, K on HM, JR || KQ, KQ || LP, R on MS, HS || LP, L on HM, J on HM, L on JM, J on HL, ∠HMQ, 2 = JK, L on KM, 4 = KL, 3 = MP, ∠HMP, P on MQ, K on JL, HS || KQ

Step 2:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : JR || KQ
Conclusions: ∠MQK = ∠MRJ, ∠MJR = ∠MKQ

Step 3:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : KQ || LP
Conclusions: ∠MPL = ∠MQK, ∠MKQ = ∠MLP

Step 4:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : R on MS
Conclusions: MS = MR + RS

Step 5:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : HS || LP
Conclusions: ∠MPL = ∠MSH

Step 6:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : L on HM
Conclusions: HM = HL + LM

Step 7:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : J on HM
Conclusions: HM = HJ + JM

Step 8:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : L on JM
Conclusions: JM = JL + LM

Step 9:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : J on HL
Conclusions: HL = HJ + JL

Step 10:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : K on HM, ∠HMQ
Conclusions: ∠HMQ = ∠KMQ

Step 11:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : L on HM, ∠HMQ
Conclusions: ∠HMQ = ∠LMQ

Step 12:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : L on KM
Conclusions: KM = KL + LM

Step 13:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 2 = JK, 4 = KL
Conclusions: 6 = JK + KL

Step 14:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 6 = PQ, 3 = MP
Conclusions: 9 = MP + PQ

Step 15:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : L on HM, ∠HMP
Conclusions: ∠HMP = ∠LMP

Step 16:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : P on MQ, ∠HMQ
Conclusions: ∠HMP = ∠HMQ

Step 17:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : P on MQ
Conclusions: MQ = MP + PQ

Step 18:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : K on JL
Conclusions: JL = JK + KL

Step 19:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : HS || KQ
Conclusions: ∠MHS = ∠MKQ

Step 20:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠MQK = ∠MRJ, ∠MJR = ∠MKQ
Conclusions: △JMR ~ △KMQ

Step 21:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠MPL = ∠MQK, ∠MPL = ∠MSH
Conclusions: ∠MQK = ∠MSH

Step 22:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠HMQ = ∠LMQ, ∠HMQ = ∠KMQ
Conclusions: ∠KMQ = ∠LMQ

Step 23:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠HMP = ∠HMQ, ∠HMQ = ∠LMQ, ∠HMP = ∠LMP
Conclusions: ∠LMP = ∠LMQ

Step 24:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 9 = MP + PQ, MQ = MP + PQ
Conclusions: 9 = MQ

Step 25:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : JL = JK + KL, 6 = JK + KL
Conclusions: 6 = JL

Step 26:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △JMR ~ △KMQ
Conclusions: ∠MQK = ∠MRJ, JM / KM = MR / MQ, sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = JM / KM

Step 27:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠MHS = ∠MKQ, ∠MQK = ∠MSH
Conclusions: △HMS ~ △KMQ

Step 28:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠LMP = ∠LMQ, ∠KMQ = ∠LMQ
Conclusions: ∠KMQ = ∠LMP

Step 29:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 9 = MQ, JM / KM = MR / MQ
Conclusions: MR / 9 = JM / KM

Step 30:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △HMS ~ △KMQ
Conclusions: HM / KM = MS / MQ, sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_k_m_q = MS / MQ, ∠MQK = ∠MSH

Step 31:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠MPL = ∠MQK, ∠MKQ = ∠MLP, ∠KMQ = ∠LMP
Conclusions: △KMQ ~ △LMP

Step 32:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = JM / KM, MR / 9 = JM / KM
Conclusions: sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = MR / 9

Step 33:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : HM / KM = MS / MQ, 9 = MQ
Conclusions: MS / 9 = HM / KM

Step 34:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 9 = MQ, sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_k_m_q = MS / MQ
Conclusions: sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_k_m_q = MS / 9

Step 35:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △KMQ ~ △LMP
Conclusions: ∠MPL = ∠MQK, KM / LM = MQ / MP, ∠KMQ = ∠LMP

Step 36:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_k_m_q = MS / 9
Conclusions: 9 * sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_k_m_q = MS

Step 37:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 9 = MQ, 3 = MP, KM / LM = MQ / MP
Conclusions: 9 / 3 = KM / LM

Step 38:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : MS = MR + RS, 9 * sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_k_m_q = MS
Conclusions: 9 * sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_k_m_q = MR + RS

Step 39:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 6 = JL, 9 / 3 = KM / LM, JM = JL + LM, 4 = KL, KM = KL + LM
Conclusions: 8 = JM

Step 40:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 9 / 3 = KM / LM, 4 = KL, KM = KL + LM
Conclusions: 6 = KM

Step 41:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 8 = JM, JM = JL + LM
Conclusions: 8 = JL + LM

Step 42:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : MS / 9 = HM / KM, 6 = KM, 9 * sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_k_m_q = MS
Conclusions: (9 * sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_k_m_q) / 9 = HM / 6

Step 43:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 6 = KM, 6 = RS
Conclusions: KM = RS

Step 44:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 8 = JM, 6 = KM
Conclusions: 1.33 = JM / KM

Step 45:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = JM / KM, 1.33 = JM / KM
Conclusions: 1.33 = sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q

Step 46:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 8 = JL + LM, HM = HL + LM, KM = RS, 1.33 = sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q, HM = HJ + JM, 1.33 = JM / KM, 9 * sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_k_m_q = MR + RS, sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = MR / 9, HL = HJ + JL, (9 * sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_k_m_q) / 9 = HM / 6
Conclusions: 4 = HJ
